intro: Gourliea decorticans, commonly known as the African sand-dollar, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, waxy leaves. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family. Gourliea decorticans is often found in sandy soils and is valued for its ornamental appearance and drought tolerance.
